headline.main: WRECK OF THE BARK HAWTHORNE.; SUFFERINGS OF THE CREW--TWO OF THEM DROWNED--THE CAPTAIN AND OTHERS RESCUED BY A BRITISH BARK.
BURNED TO THE WATER'S EDGE.; DESTRUCTION OF A MISSISSIPPI STEAM-BOAT --SEVERAL MEN REPORTED CRIPPLED.

docs.snippet: William P. Clyde  Co., the agents of the lost steamer Emily B. Souder, waited all day yesterday for an answer to their telegram asking the United States Consul at Kingston, Jamaica, to cable such particulars of the disaster as could be gleaned fro...
docs.lead_paragraph: William P. Clyde Co., the agents of the lost steamer Emily B. Souder, waited all day yesterday for an answer to their telegram asking the United States Consul at Kingston, Jamaica, to cable such particulars of the disaster as could be gleaned from the two rescued seamen reported as having landed there.

headline.main: THE FOUNDERED STEAMER.; A DISPATCH RECEIVED GIVING FURTHER PARTICULARS OF THE LOSS OF THE EMILY B. SOUDER.

docs.snippet: LONDON, July 8.--Advices from St. Helena, via Madeira, July 6, state that the American ship Akbar, Capt. Lamson, from Java for Boston or the Channel, was abandoned. Her crew landed at St. Helena....
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 8.--Advices from St. Helena, via Madeira, July 6, state that the American ship Akbar, Capt. Lamson, from Java for Boston or the Channel, was abandoned. Her crew landed at St. Helena.

headline.main: RESCUE OF AN AMERICAN CREW.; HEROIC CONDUCT OF A VOLUNTEER BOAT'S CREW FROM A BRITISH BARK.

docs.snippet: RESCUERS OF THE JOHN GILPIN REWARDED. The Government at Washington has awarded the sum of $2,574 60 to Capt. CHARLES A. FERGUSON, the owner of the ship Herefordshire of London, for detention and expenses incurred by that vessel in rescuing the pas...
docs.lead_paragraph: RESCUERS OF THE JOHN GILPIN REWARDED. The Government at Washington has awarded the sum of $2,574 60 to Capt. CHARLES A. FERGUSON, the owner of the ship Herefordshire of London, for detention and expenses incurred by that vessel in rescuing the passengers and crew of the ship John Gilpin, wrecked off Cape Horn, and taking them to Bahia.
